fluid.definition: a substance that is fluid at room temperature and pressure
continuous amorphous matter that tends to flow and to conform to the outline of its container: a liquid or a gas

examples: a fluid situation fraught with uncertainty
everything was unstable following the coup

fluid.definition: characteristic of a fluid; capable of flowing and easily changing shape

examples: the fluid motion of a cat
the liquid grace of a ballerina

fluid.definition: in cash or easily convertible to cash

examples: Britain is not a truly fluid society

Tree.definition: a tall perennial woody plant having a main trunk and branches forming a distinct elevated crown; includes both gymnosperms and angiosperms
a figure that branches from a single root
English actor and theatrical producer noted for his lavish productions of Shakespeare (1853-1917)
force a person or an animal into a position from which he cannot escape

examples: this lot should be treed so that the house will be shaded in summer

Tree.definition: chase an animal up a tree
examples: the hunters treed the bear with dogs and killed it
her dog likes to tree squirrels
